header.gameNote: COACHES VS CANCER CLASSIC AT WHITE PLAINS NY

article.headline: Iona 56, Vermont 53
article.story: WHITE PLAINS, N.Y. (AP) -- DeShaun Williams scored nine of his 10 points on 3-point shots, and got the go-ahead basket with 41 seconds left to help Iona beat Vermont 56-53 Monday night in a Coaches vs. Cancer Classic matchup. Ricky Soliver and Steve Burtt added nine points apiece for the Gaels (1-1), who overcame a 10-point second-half deficit. Taylor Coppenrath had 16 points, T.J. Sorrentine 14 and Alex Jensen 12 for the Catamounts (0-2). Coppenrath had 14 points in the first half, helping Vermont to a 31-27 lead at the break. Jensen's 3-pointer with 12:24 remaining pushed the Catamounts to their largest lead at 43-33. Burtt's 3-pointer evened the score at 46-46 with 5:56 to go, and Iona led briefly before Jensen's 3-point goal tied it at 51-51 with 2:07 left. Williams then hit the go-ahead 3-pointer for the Gaels, although Germain Njila scored to pull Vermont to 54-53 with 16 seconds left. Two free throws by Soliver concluded the scoring. Both Steve Smith and Greg Jenkins had eight points for Iona, which overcame 18 turnovers and held Vermont to 31.3-percent shooting.
